Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia Phillies will face the Chicago Cubs in Game of the League Series at Citizens Bank Park on Tuesday, starting at 8:40am AEST.
Aaron Nola (12-8, 3.54 ERA) will start on the mound for the Phillies, while the Cubs are going with Nate Pearson (2-2, 4.71 ERA).
Stats Insider's predictive analytics model gives the Phillies a 63% chance of beating the Cubs at Citizens Bank Park.
The Phillies are 1.5-run favourites against the Cubs, with odds of $2.02 available at TAB.
For the underdog Cubs (+1.5) to cover the line, TAB offers odds of $1.81.
The over/under for total runs scored is set at 8 with TAB, which has odds of $1.91 for the over and $1.91 for the under.
According to Stats Insider's analytics model, the Cubs (+1.5) are predicted to cover the line 54% of the time, while the 8-run over/under is expected to go over 54% of the time.

While the Phillies have a higher chance of winning the game, betting on the Cubs to win is our preferred option because of the 1.2% edge identified when comparing our data-driven probabilities to the odds currently on offer.
